alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:27PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso and north central Pueblo Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fountain, or 10 miles southeast of Colorado Springs, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Colorado Springs, Fountain, Fort Carson, Security, Security-Widefield, Stratmoor and Hanover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for southeastern and east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet
